subject: Re: [junit] Assertions in JUnit
msgSnippet: ... If a test doesn t fail, then it passes. ... The TestRunners report the failed tests after a test run. If a test did not fail, then it passed. ... If you
messageBody:
>So said brijesh gopal on 2003-06-11 --------------------
>Assertions say whether the test was success or not.Is
>there any other way in JUnit where we can find out if
>the test case has gone succesfully or not?

If a test doesn't fail, then it passes.

>(Automated....i dont want to go to the logs and read
>it)

The TestRunners report the failed tests after a test run. If a test did not fail, then it passed.
>
>Also, if i want to generate reports using JUnit and
>ANT, I need to have assertions in my test class. Is
>that right?

If you want tests that do anything at all, you need assertions; otherwise your tests all pass.

Please read my tutorial on JUnit, which discusses pass, fail, error. It may clarify some things for you.

http://www.diasparsoftware.com/articles/JUnit/jUnitStarterGuide.html

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
